translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The third section
The eighth person

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: “Is the perversion of view abandoned in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamako puggalo sotāpanno sotāpattiphalappatto paṭiladdho adhigato sacchikato upasampajja viharati, kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakaḥ puggalo sotāpanno sotāpatti phala ppatto paṭiladdhaḥ adhigato sacchikataḥ upasampajja viharati kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Has the eighth person attained the fruit of stream-entry, realized the fruit of stream-entry, attained and realized the fruit of stream-entry, and does he dwell in the experience of that fruit? Does he touch it with his body and dwell in it?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the ear faculty … in the nose faculty … in the tongue faculty … in the body faculty … in the mind faculty?” …

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: “Is the perversion of doubt abandoned in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamako puggalo sotāpanno sotāpattiphalappatto …pe… kāyena phusitvā viharatīti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamako puggalo sotāpanno sotāpatti phala ppatto pe kāyena phusitvā viharati iti
translated: “Has the eighth person attained the fruit of stream-entry, realized the fruit of stream-entry, attained and realized the fruit of stream-entry, and does he dwell in the experience of that fruit? Does he touch it with his body and dwell in it?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the ear faculty … in the nose faculty … in the tongue faculty … in the body faculty … in the mind faculty?” …

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: “Is the perversion of view abandoned in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭha anusayo pahīno ti
translated: “Is the underlying tendency to view abandoned in the eighth person?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: “Is the perversion of view abandoned in the eighth person?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ sīla bbata parāmāso pahīno ti
translated: Has the cankerous influence of uncertainty … the cankerous influence of adherence to rules and observances been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: Has the fetter of uncertainty been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā anusayo pahīno ti
translated: Has the cankerous influence of uncertainty been abandoned by the eighth person?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānaṁ pahīnanti?🔽Āmantā.
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti  āmantā
translated: … He should not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭha anusayo sīla bbata parāmāso pahīno ti
translated: Has the cankerous influence of views … the cankerous influence of adherence to rules and observances been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṁ appahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhānusayo appahīno ti  āmantā  aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam appahīnanti
translated: Has the cankerous influence of views not been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.
Has the fetter of views not been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.
Has the fetter of uncertainty not been abandoned by the eighth person?
… He should not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā anusayo sīla bbata parāmāso appahīno ti
translated: Has the canker of views not been abandoned by the eighth person?
Yes.
Has the canker of uncertainty not been abandoned by the eighth person?
You may not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa sīla bbata parāmāso appahīno ti
translated: Has the canker of adherence to rules and observances not been abandoned by the eighth person?
Yes.
Has the canker of sensual desire not been abandoned by the eighth person?
You may not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: Has the canker of sensual desire been abandoned by the eighth person?
Yes.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya maggaḥ bhāvito ti
translated: Has the path that leads to the abandoning of the canker of sensual desire been developed by the eighth person?
You may not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: Has the canker of sensual desire been abandoned by the eighth person?
Yes.

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānapahānāya satipaṭṭhānā bhāvitā …pe… sammappadhānā …pe… bojjhaṅgā bhāvitāti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya sati paṭṭhānā bhāvitā pe sammappadhānā pe bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā ati
translated: Has the way that leads to the abandoning of the canker of sensual desire been developed by the eighth person?
You may not say so.

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: Has the eighth person abandoned the obsession of uncertainty?
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānapahānāya maggo bhāvito …pe… bojjhaṅgā bhāvitāti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya maggaḥ bhāvito pe bojjhaṅgā bhāvitā ati
translated: “Has the eighth person developed the path for the abandoning of the obsession of uncertainty … the factors of enlightenment?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya maggaḥ a bhāvito ti
translated: “Has the eighth person not developed the path for the abandoning of the obsession of views …
“Yes.”

analyzed: amaggena pahīnam lokiyena sa āsavena pe saṅkilesiyena ati
translated: “Is what has been abandoned by the path not abandoned by the mundane, subject to cankers, associated with the cankers, arisen together with the cankers?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānapahānāya satipaṭṭhānā …pe… bojjhaṅgā abhāvitāti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya sati paṭṭhānā pe bojjhaṅgāḥ abhāvitā ati
translated: “Has the eighth person not developed the foundations of mindfulness … the factors of enlightenment for the abandoning of the obsession of views …
“Yes.”

analyzed: amaggena pahīnam lokiyena sa āsavena pe saṅkilesiyena ati
translated: “Is what has been abandoned by the path not abandoned by the mundane, subject to cankers, associated with the cankers, arisen together with the cankers?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the ear faculty … in the nose faculty … in the tongue faculty … in the body faculty … in the mind faculty?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānapahānāya maggo abhāvito …pe… satipaṭṭhānā …pe… bojjhaṅgā abhāvitāti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhāna pahānāya maggaḥ abhāvito pe satipaṭṭhānā pe bojjhaṅgāḥ abhāvitā ati
translated: “Has the eighth person not developed the path for the abandoning of the obsession of uncertainty … the foundations of mindfulness … the factors of enlightenment?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is what has been abandoned by the path not abandoned by the mundane, subject to cankers, associated with the cankers, arisen together with the cankers?”🔽“No.”

original: Amaggena pahīnaṁ lokiyena sāsavena …pe… saṅkilesiyenāti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: amaggena pahīnam lokiyena sa āsavena pe saṅkilesiyena ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it abandoned by the stomach?”🔽“No, friend.”
“Then it should be said:

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: ‘The perversions of the eighth person are abandoned.’
“Yes, friend.
“Will it arise?”
“It will not arise.”

original: Hañci nuppajjissati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci nuppajjissati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If it will not arise, then it should be said:

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: ‘The perversions of the eighth person are abandoned.’
“It should not be said:

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: ‘The perplexity of the eighth person is abandoned.’
“Yes, friend.
“Will it arise?”
“It will not arise.”

original: Hañci nuppajjissati, tena vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci nuppajjissati tena vata re vattabbe
translated: “If it will not arise, then it should be said:

analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam pahīnam ti
translated: ‘The perplexity of the eighth person is abandoned.’

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Is it because the perversions of the eighth person will not arise that they are said to be abandoned?”
“Yes, friend.

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhānusayo nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnoti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhānusayaḥ na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnaḥ ti
translated: “Is it because the underlying tendency to wrong view of the eighth person will not arise that it is said to be abandoned?”
“No, friend.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s obsession by views been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchānusayo … sīlabbataparāmāso nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnoti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ sīlabbata parāmāso nuppajjissati iti katvā pahīnaḥ ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s underlying tendency to doubt … his clinging to rules and observances been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s obsession by doubt been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Yes.”

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchānusayo … sīlabbataparāmāso nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnoti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ sīlabbata parāmāso nuppajjissati iti katvā pahīnaḥ ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s underlying tendency to doubt … his clinging to rules and observances been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s obsession by views been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Yes.”

original: Gotrabhuno puggalassa diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: gotrabhunaḥ puggalassa diṭṭhi pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Has the person who has entered the fixed course of rightness’s obsession by views been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: aṭṭhamakassa puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Has the eighth person’s obsession by doubt been given up because it will not arise again?”
“Yes.”

original: Gotrabhuno puggalassa vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānaṁ nuppajjissatīti katvā pahīnanti?
analyzed: gotrabhunaḥ puggalassa vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhānam na uppajjissati iti katvā pahīnam ti
translated: “Because of the non-arising of the perversions of views, etc., in a person who has reached the path of stream-entry, are the perversions of views, etc., abandoned by him?”
“That can’t be said.”
The eighth section is finished.
